docs.lead_paragraph: Stores that accept food stamps should give more space to produce.

headline.main: See No Junk Food, Buy No Junk Food
headline.print_headline: See No Junk, Buy No Junk

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by health advocates Thomas A Farley and Russell Sykes, noting that $1.7 billion in federal food stamp dollars are spent on junk food each year, suggests ways to encourage Americans to use food stamps for healthier fare; holds government should give financial incentive for healthy food purchases or restrict use of food stamps for junk food and require that stores allocate more, and more visible, space to healthier foods.
docs.snippet: Stores that accept food stamps should give more space to produce.

byline.original: By THOMAS A. FARLEY and RUSSELL SYKES

docs.lead_paragraph: Pilot projects in 10 states will train recipients and offer services like transportation and child care, the Obama administration announced on Friday.

headline.main: $200 Million to Help Food Stamp Recipients Find Jobs
headline.print_headline: Obama Grants $200 Million to 10 States to Help Food Stamp Recipients Find Jobs

docs.abstract: Obama administration announces it will give $200 million in grants to 10 states participating in projects aimed at helping food stamp recipients find jobs; pilot program is part of larger effort to reduce food stamp program rolls, which have grown to nearly 50 million Americans.
docs.snippet: Pilot projects in 10 states will train recipients and offer services like transportation and child care, the Obama administration announced on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration said that genetically engineered nonbrowning apples and bruise-resistant potatoes were as safe and nutritious as their conventional counterparts.

headline.main: Gene-Altered Apples and Potatoes Are Safe, F.D.A. Says
headline.print_headline: Gene-Altered Apples and Potatoes Are Safe, F.D.A. Says

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration says bruise-resistant potatoes and nonbrowning apples that are genetically engineered by J R Simplot Company and Okanagan Specialty Fruits, respectively, are as safe and nutritious as their normal counterparts; FDA rarely issues news releases about reviews of genetically modified crops, but did so in apparent acknowledgment of public attention paid to these two particular crops.
docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration said that genetically engineered nonbrowning apples and bruise-resistant potatoes were as safe and nutritious as their conventional counterparts.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers say the milk is brimming with potential therapeutic agents, for babies and also possibly adults.

headline.main: Breast Milk Becomes a Commodity, With Mothers Caught Up in Debate
headline.print_headline: Worries Vie With Hopes as Breast Milk Becomes Big Business

docs.abstract: Breast milk is among latest frontiers of biotechnology industry, thereby becoming an industrial commodity; researchers say they hope to synthesize and distill variety of potential therapeutics from breast milk for treatment of varied diseases; skeptics of fledgling industry have expressed concerns, particularly about how it will impact nonprofit milk banks.
docs.snippet: Researchers say the milk is brimming with potential therapeutic agents, for babies and also possibly adults.

docs.lead_paragraph: The hedge fund firm run by activist investor William Ackman said on Friday a federal judge's recent dismissal of a shareholder lawsuit against Herbalife Ltd did not "exonerate or bless" its business practices.

headline.main: Herbalife Not Exonerated by U.S. Judge: Pershing Square
headline.print_headline: Herbalife Not Exonerated by U.S. Judge: Pershing Square

docs.snippet: The hedge fund firm run by activist investor William Ackman said on Friday a federal judge's recent dismissal of a shareholder lawsuit against Herbalife Ltd did not "exonerate or bless" its business practices.

docs.lead_paragraph: New federal grants will help 10 states test programs to help food stamp recipients find jobs, from using career coaches to quicker training courses to mental health assistance.

headline.main: States to Test Ways to Send Food Stamp Recipients to Work
headline.print_headline: States to Test Ways to Send Food Stamp Recipients to Work

docs.snippet: New federal grants will help 10 states test programs to help food stamp recipients find jobs, from using career coaches to quicker training courses to mental health assistance.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the amount of human-created information spirals ever higher, our ability to sift through it has not kept pace. Increasingly condensed specialization is one result.

headline.main: In the Age of Information, Specializing to Survive
headline.print_headline: If You Can Know It All, How Come You Don’t?

docs.abstract: Anyone can learn almost anything, thanks to the Internet, but because of modern-day information overload and proliferation of massive open online classes, it has become almost impossible to master even one area of study, unlike the ancient masters or Renaissance men.
docs.snippet: As the amount of human-created information spirals ever higher, our ability to sift through it has not kept pace. Increasingly condensed specialization is one result.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees, forever looking for a competitive edge, hired a new nutritionist over the winter and charged her with recommending healthy foods and persuading players to eat them.

headline.main: Yankees’ Pinstripes May Be Slimming, but a Nutritionist Helps
headline.print_headline: Pinstripes May Be Slimming, but a Nutritionist Helps

docs.abstract: New York Yankees hire nutritionist Cynthia Sass to create healthy meals for team cafeteria and gently persuade players to choose them over foods they may be more used to.
docs.snippet: The Yankees, forever looking for a competitive edge, hired a new nutritionist over the winter and charged her with recommending healthy foods and persuading players to eat them.

docs.lead_paragraph: Want to know how many calories are in your shot of Johnnie Walker or your pint of Guinness? You're about to find out.

headline.main: Labels to Say How Many Calories in That Johnnie Walker Shot
headline.print_headline: Labels to Say How Many Calories in That Johnnie Walker Shot

docs.snippet: Want to know how many calories are in your shot of Johnnie Walker or your pint of Guinness? You're about to find out.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack says the University of Kentucky will become home to his department's first center assigned to tackle childhood hunger and nutrition problems in rural America.

headline.main: Kentucky Will Have Rural Child Poverty Nutrition Center
headline.print_headline: Kentucky Will Have Rural Child Poverty Nutrition Center

docs.snippet: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack says the University of Kentucky will become home to his department's first center assigned to tackle childhood hunger and nutrition problems in rural America.
